contexts.name: Clinical & Genomic Data Portal
contexts.purpose: Interactive portal UI for clinicians/researchers to explore studies, view mutations, survival plots, and cohort summaries.
contexts.boundaryNotes: Presentation logic and query semantics are tightly coupled; frontend leans directly on backend's data model.
contexts.notes: High visibility. Drives perceived value for clinical/research users. Backed by React/MobX frontend and Java backend REST API.

contexts.name: Programmatic Access API
contexts.purpose: Published REST API (OpenAPI spec) that external tools/scripts call for cohort data, mutations, and study metadata.
contexts.boundaryNotes: Contracts are documented and relatively stable. Backwards compatibility pressure comes from downstream consumers.
contexts.notes: Acts as an Open Host Service. External research consumers must conform to its language.

contexts.name: Cohort / Query & Analysis Engine
contexts.purpose: Query logic for cohorts, clinical/genomic joins, survival analysis, and study-level analytics.
contexts.boundaryNotes: Domain language from research bleeds into UI and API with few translation boundaries. Performance tuning drives design.
contexts.notes: Differentiator. Feeds both the Portal UI and programmatic API. Tight coupling to curated relational schemas.

contexts.name: Session & Virtual Study Service
contexts.purpose: Stores user-created virtual studies, saved groups, and analysis sessions. Java + MongoDB, only reachable via backend proxy.
contexts.boundaryNotes: Backend mediates access. Frontend cannot talk to Mongo directly.
contexts.notes: Holds user-specific context like saved cohorts. Access controlled by backend-only proxy. Supports collaboration / revisitability.

contexts.name: Data Ingestion & Validation Pipeline
contexts.purpose: Validates incoming study data (via validator/metaImport.py) and loads it into cBioPortal's datastore.
contexts.boundaryNotes: Import scripts and validation logic live alongside backend code. Operational coupling and tribal knowledge.
contexts.notes: Onboarding new studies bottlenecks here. Mix of Python wrappers + Java import classes. Informal ownership, lots of implicit rules.

contexts.name: Clinical / Genomic Data Store
contexts.purpose: Authoritative MySQL OLTP database (optionally ClickHouse for OLAP). Source of truth for study data, mutations, clinical attributes.
contexts.boundaryNotes: Schema design is shared by ingestion, query engine, and API. Hard to evolve without coordinated changes everywhere.
contexts.notes: High coupling. Acts as a shared kernel between ingestion and query/analysis. Performance tuning via Redis/ClickHouse leaks infra concerns upward.

contexts.name: OncoKB Knowledge Base
contexts.purpose: External precision oncology knowledge base providing variant interpretation and clinical significance.
contexts.boundaryNotes: We consume their taxonomy (conformist). We cannot rename or reshape their definitions.
contexts.notes: External upstream. We depend on OncoKB for classification of mutations and treatment implications.

contexts.name: Genome Nexus Annotation Service
contexts.boundaryNotes: Consumed as a utility service for variant annotation; we adopt their model.
contexts.notes: Provides standardized variant annotations and references. We treat it as commodity enrichment.

contexts.name: External Research Consumers
contexts.purpose: Downstream partners and analyst workflows consuming exported cohorts and clinical/genomic insights via the public API.
contexts.boundaryNotes: They depend on our published API contract. Backwards-compat pressure originates here.
contexts.notes: Represents hospitals, research partners, downstream analysis pipelines. They integrate via our Open Host Service.

relationships.description: Portal adopts query engine's domain language and result shapes without an anti-corruption layer.
UI and programmatic API share exposed terminology for mutations, studies, cohorts.
External research consumers must integrate via the published API contract; we promise stability.
Query/analysis is downstream of curated schema; storage defines what's possible/performance-feasible.

relationships.communicationMode: validator + import classes writing MySQL schema
relationships.description: Ingestion pipeline and storage tightly co-own schema evolution; changes require coordination.

relationships.communicationMode: Session state proxied via backend REST API
relationships.description: Portal relies on persisted virtual studies / saved groups exposed via backend-only access to session service.
We adopt OncoKB's oncology significance classifications.
We consume Genome Nexus annotations as-is and treat them as authoritative enrichment.

repos.name: cbioportal
repos.analysisSummary: Primary codebase containing backend REST API, validator, import pipeline, and bundled frontend. High change velocity; boundary between ingestion and runtime logic is blurry.

repos.name: session-service
repos.analysisSummary: Stores virtual studies / saved cohorts in MongoDB. Only reachable via backend proxy; front end never talks directly to it.

repos.name: datahub
repos.analysisSummary: Validator, metaImport.py, and curated study data loading. Social bottleneck: knowledge concentrated in a few maintainers.

groups.label: Research Insights Surface
groups.notes: All clinician/research-facing capabilities. High perceived value. Drives funding and roadmap pressure.

groups.label: Data Platform / Ingestion
groups.notes: Data onboarding, curation, enrichment. Platform-like capability that other flows rely on.

actors.name: Clinical Researcher
actors.description: Oncology researchers exploring patient cohorts, survival data, and mutation patterns for research studies

actors.name: Treating Oncologist
actors.description: Clinicians looking up genomic profiles and treatment options for specific cancer patients

actors.name: Bioinformatician
actors.description: Computational biologists using programmatic API access to integrate cBioPortal data into analysis pipelines

userNeeds.name: Explore patient cohorts across studies
userNeeds.description: Search and filter cancer studies, view mutation frequencies, and identify research cohorts

userNeeds.name: Analyze survival outcomes
userNeeds.description: Run survival analysis on patient cohorts to identify prognostic factors

userNeeds.name: Save and share research findings
userNeeds.description: Persist virtual studies and patient groups for collaboration and future analysis

userNeeds.name: Look up patient genomic profile
userNeeds.description: View specific patient's mutations and genomic alterations for treatment planning

userNeeds.name: Find treatment options
userNeeds.description: Identify actionable mutations and relevant therapies based on genomic profile

userNeeds.name: Automate data analysis
userNeeds.description: Integrate cBioPortal data into computational pipelines and custom analysis workflows

userNeeds.name: Export cohort data
userNeeds.description: Retrieve structured clinical and genomic data for downstream analysis
